DataElement.preferredName: Bioassay Threshold For Qualitative And Quantitative Outcome Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to a question that asks if there is a different threshold for qualitative and qualitative results.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bioassay Threshold For Qualitative And Quantitative Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98)_The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant._The reason of something._A measurement expressed in words rather than numbers._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Capable of being estimated or expressed with numeric values._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test/analysis of biological activity of a substance by studying its effect on an organism or in test tube under controlled conditions.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test or analysis of the biological activity of a substance performed by studying its effect on an organism or in a test tube under controlled conditions.

Property.preferredName: Threshold For Qualitative And Quantitative Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition:
The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant.:The reason of something.
:A measurement expressed in words rather than numbers.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Capable of being estimated or expressed with numeric values.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant.
A measurement expressed in words rather than numbers.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Capable of being estimated or expressed with numeric values.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are there different threshold
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are there different thresholds or cutoffs for qualitative and quantitative results
